meanings.definition: One who illuminates or lights up.
meanings.sent1: The illuminator brightened the room with a lamp.
meanings.sent2: The streetlight acted as an illuminator on the dark road.
meanings.sent3: The little firefly thought he was the best illuminator in the forest.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like an illuminator, bringing light to everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse served as a powerful illuminator for ships at sea.

meanings.definition: A device or substance that provides light.
meanings.sent1: The flashlight was a handy illuminator during the blackout.
meanings.sent2: The sun is a natural illuminator for the Earth.
meanings.sent3: The glow stick was the illuminator of the party, lighting up the dance floor.
meanings.sent4: The stars in the night sky acted as tiny illuminators in the darkness.
meanings.sent5: The candle served as a romantic illuminator during the dinner date.

meanings.definition: An artist who decorates manuscripts with illustrations or designs.
meanings.sent1: The illuminator carefully added intricate details to the ancient text.
meanings.sent2: The medieval illuminator painted beautiful borders on the pages.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel thought he could be an illuminator by drawing on the tree bark.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity as an illuminator knew no bounds, turning plain pages into works of art.
meanings.sent5: The talented illuminator brought life to the stories through vibrant illustrations.
